radiographic_examinations.findings: Complex multiple spinal malformations including hemispondylous malformations at multiple contiguous thoracic levels, diastematomyelia at T1–5, and thoracic lipomeningocele at T6–7. A large posterior median bone spur split the spinal canal into two symmetrical halves, each containing a hemicord with its own dural sac. A large syrinx cavity extending from T-1 to C-6. A dermoid cyst was present in the upper and lateral part of the lipomeningocele.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Preoperative moderate ventricular dilation was decompressed by the surgical repair of the spinal malformation.
